text: James Graham Brown (August 18, 1881 â€” March 20, 1969) was an American businessman and philanthropist. He was a hotel owner in Louisville, Kentucky. It was his hotel, the Brown Hotel, which first served the hot sandwich. The name Hot Brown meaning a type of hot sandwich comes either from Brown himself, or his hotel.
